intro: Tetractinostigma microcalyx, commonly known as the small-fruited tetractinostigma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and produces small, white flowers that are often fragrant. Its fruits are berries that contain several seeds, and the plant is typically found in lowland forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and lesser-known member of the Rubiaceae family.
